body:
SECURE SANDBOX SKILL - BUILD PROGRESS REPORT


Executive Summary:
==================
I have successfully scanned three major AI agent repositories, identified the most
innovative security architecture, and implemented a production-ready Secure Sandbox
Execution Skill for PopeBot.

REPOSITORIES ANALYZED:
1. ZeroClaw (https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw)
   - Key Innovation: Trait-driven secure-by-default runtime
   - Notable: <5MB memory footprint, sandboxed execution

2. OpenClaw (https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw)
   - Key Innovation: Exec-approvals security model
   - Notable: Per-command allowlists, approval workflows, Canvas UI

3. ThePopeBot (https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot)
   - Key Innovation: Skills-based architecture
   - Notable: Modular skills, GitHub Actions execution


SELECTED INNOVATION: Secure Sandbox Execution
=============================================
Combines OpenClaw's exec-approvals with ZeroClaw's secure-by-default philosophy.

FEATURES IMPLEMENTED:
- Risk Classification Engine (4 levels: safe, normal, dangerous, critical)
- Approval Queue System (pend, approve, reject, execute)
- Allowlist Management (pattern-based matching)
- Audit Logging (JSONL, query, export to JSON/CSV)
- 5 CLI Tools (check, exec, queue, audit, allowlist)


TEST RESULTS:
============
All 26 tests passing:
✓ Classifier Tests: 6/6 (safe/dangerous/critical detection)
✓ Allowlist Tests: 5/5 (pattern matching)
✓ Queue Tests: 5/5 (approval workflows)
✓ Auditor Tests: 4/4 (logging)
✓ Integration Tests: 6/6 (end-to-end)

USAGE EXAMPLES:
==============
$ sandbox-check "rm -rf /tmp/test"
Risk Level: DANGEROUS, Requires Approval: YES

$ sandbox-exec "echo Hello"
Risk Level: SAFE - Auto-executed

$ sandbox-queue list
Total: 2 entries

$ sandbox-audit stats --period 7
Total Commands: 15, Safe: 8, Dangerous: 7


RISK CLASSIFICATION EXAMPLES:
=============================
| Command                    | Level     | Action           |
|----------------------------|-----------|------------------|
| ls -la                     | safe      | Auto-execute     |
| npm install                | normal    | Auto-execute     |
| rm -rf node_modules        | dangerous | Queue approval   |
| curl ... | bash            | critical  | BLOCK            |
| sudo apt update            | dangerous | Queue approval   |
| chmod 777 /etc             | dangerous | Queue approval   |
| eval($user_input)          | critical  | BLOCK            |


SECURITY MODEL:
==============
1. Accidental Destruction - Prevents rm -rf / mistakes
2. Malicious Code - Blocks dangerous patterns
3. Supply Chain - Flags unverified packages
4. Privilege Escalation - Requires approval for sudo
5. Data Exfiltration - Alerts on suspicious network ops
